qas.question: When did he write his first works on Orthodox Christianity?
Which of the two first works addresses pagan practices?
How did he believe Jesus came into the world?
Which of his works addresses redemption and the Son of God?

answers.text: Incarnation of the Word of God

qas.question: When did he write his last works on Orthodox Christianity?
Which of the last works addresses pagan practices?
How did he not believe Jesus came into the world?

plausible_answers.text: Incarnation of the Word of God

qas.question: Which of his works did not address redemption and the Son of God?

context: Athanasius also wrote a two-part <a1_0><b5_0>Against the Heathen<b5_0/><a1_0/> and The <a3_0><b7_0>Incarnation of the Word of God<b7_0/><a3_0/>. Completed probably early in his life, <a0_0><b4_0>before the Arian controversy<b4_0/><a0_0/>, they constitute the first classic work of developed Orthodox theology. In the first part, Athanasius attacks several pagan practices and beliefs. The second part presents teachings on the redemption. Also in these books, Athanasius put forward the belief that the Son of God, the eternal Word through whom God created the world, entered that world <a2_0><b6_0>in human form<b6_0/><a2_0/> to lead men back into the harmony from which they had earlier fallen away.
